file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 56-20-01-06 - PASSENGER CABIN WINDOWS - INSPECTION/CHECK

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL PASSENGER CABIN WINDOWS - INSPECTION/CHECK EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedure to do an inspection of the passenger cabin windows for delamination and crazing. B. Delamination is a condition which occurs when there is a separation of the interlayer from the acrylic surface. C. Crazing is a concentration of many short cracks on the acrylic surface. D. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY PASSENGER CABIN WINDOWS - IN- ALL 56-20-01-200-801-A ♦ SPECTION/CHECK EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 56-20-01 Page 1 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 56-20-01-200-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. PASSENGER CABIN WINDOWS - INSPECTION/CHECK A. General (1) Obey these instructions to do the check of the passenger cabin windows. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION CMM 56-20-00; Section 501 - C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially To get access to the passenger cabin win- Ladder 1 available dows from the outside F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Outside the aircraft I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-003-A (1) Put the ladder in position and get access to the passenger cabin windows. J. Inspection/Check (Figure 601) SUBTASK 220-002-A (1) Do an inspect all of passenger cabin windows: (a) The Table 601 shows the area for each zone to be inspected: Table 601 - AREA FOR EACH ZONE 2 AREA Dimension (mm ) Total Transparency 120,150.00 I 90,650.00 EMB-145 - AMM 1285 200-801-A/600 56-20-01 Page 2 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL Table 601 - AREA FOR EACH ZONE (Continued) 2 AREA Dimension (mm ) II 29,500.00 (b) Do a detailed inspection of all passenger cabin windows for delamination. Result: 1 If the delamination is confined in Area II, replace the transparency according to Table 602: Table 602 - DELAMINATION IN AREA II Damage Extension (X) Definitive Action Inspection Period X ≤ 25% Replace within 800 FC 150 FC 25% < X ≤ 50% Replace within 400 FC 150 FC Replace the transparency X > 50% - before next flight. NOTE: If damage growth is detected during the inspections, replace the transparency before next flight. 2 In case the delamination reaches the Area I, replace the transparency according to Table 603: Table 603 - DELAMINATION IN AREA I Damage Extension (X) Definitive Action Inspection Period 2 X ≤ 1in Replace within 800 FC 150 FC Replace the transparency 2 X > 1in - before next flight. NOTE: If damage growth is detected during the inspections, replace the transparency before next flight. (c) Do a detailed inspection of all passenger cabin windows for crazing. Result: 2 2 1 Crazing is permitted when limited to an area not larger than 150 cm (23 in ) on the acrylic outer ply. NOTE: No crazing is permitted on the other plies. (d) For the defects that follow, please see CMM 56-20-00; Section 501: NOTE: Degradation of UV protection (or external coating) is not a criteria to remove the passenger window. • Bubbles; • Inclusions; • Partridge Eye; • Optical distortion; • Discontinuities; • Scratches. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 200-801-A/600 56-20-01 Page 3 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-003-A (1) Remove the ladder from the work area. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 200-801-A/600 56-20-01 Page 4 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
